snippet: With elections looming, lawmakers are scrambling to push through costly amendments to bills intended to meet the demands of foreign creditors.
abstract: Many members of the Greek Parliament have been scrambling to push through last-minute budget-busting amendments to bills intended to meet the demands of creditors who want Greece to implement more belt-tightening measures; the proliferation of items illustrates that Greece's practice of trading favors for political support remains entrenched, and that change may not come easily, if at all.
lead_paragraph: With elections looming, lawmakers are scrambling to push through costly amendments to bills intended to meet the demands of foreign creditors.

headline.seo: Greeks Rush to Pass Handouts Before Austerity
headline.main: Despite Warning, Old Handouts Die Hard for Greek Politicians Facing Voters Soon
headline.print_headline: Despite Warning, Old Handouts Die Hard for Greek Politicians Facing Voters Soon
